But , following the introduction of entrance test , we are selecting students even of inferior merit , said Patna College sociology teacher and Patna University Teachers ' Association former general secretary Randhir Kumar Singh .

Singh pointed out that students admitted on the basis of first list of candidates selected on the basis of performance at the entrance test are deserving , but subsequent admissions made by lowering the cutoff allow even undeserving students to enter the colleges .

Needless to say , it is these ' undeserving ' candidates who have been creating all sorts of nuisance on the college campus in recent years .
With a view to filling all the sanctioned seats in the colleges , the authorities go on lowering the cutoff marks , thereby compromising with the merit of students being selected for admission .
And , surprisingly enough , even then , 50 to 60 seats remain vacant , both in Patna College as well as B N College , said Singh .
